lines.text: Love... Love is a most complex emotion. Human beings unpredictable. No logic to emotions. Without logic, there is no rational thought. Without rational, thought there can be much romance, but much suffering.
[Alice and Joe have taken Chinese herbs that make them invisible. A cab pulls up to the curb, the back door opens by itself, and they get out]
Geez, nothing shocks these New York cab drivers!
Yeah, I know Professor Davis. He's trying to get you into the sack.
No!
female pupils.
No, he's, he's very deep! He's not like that.
Yeah, 'very deep' is exactly where he wants to put it.
[explaining to Alice why he wants to have an affair with her]
There's nothing sexier than a lapsed Catholic.
[Alice tells off her unfaithful husband, Doug]
I've done things I didn't know I had in me.
When it came to me and your dad, you had stars in your eyes.
[trying to tell Alice what he likes about her]
You have a nice personality and you know sweaters.
But then when dad died you drank yourself to death with, with margaritas.
I couldn't help it darling. You know I couldn't resist the taste of salt around the rim of a glass.
[first lines]
Hey, where are you now?
Nowhere.
It's late, I have to go.
[last lines]

[voiceover]
But - she - someone said she's a changed woman.
Speaking of changed women, Gloria Phillips had face work.
Oh, oh - ah, well, of course - she's having an affair with her astrologer, isn't she?
Yes, but she's a changed woman, because you can't tell it's Gloria!
